definition: the frog at the bottom of the well (idiom)/fig. a person of limited outlook and experience
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
a well/CL:口[kou3]/neat/orderly
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
old variant of 蛙[wa1]
frog/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.chinese: 但美国人现在都是井底之蛙了。

sentences.english: A frog in the well does not know the ocean .
sentences.chinese: 井底之蛙不知汪洋大海。

sentences.english: The frog in well knows nothing of the great ocean.
sentences.chinese: 井底之蛙不知汪洋大海。

sentences.english: Have you not heard of the frog that lived in a shallow well?
sentences.chinese: 你没有听说过井底之蛙的故事吗？

sentences.english: A frog at the bottom of a well.
sentences.chinese: 也可以说成是“井底之蛙”。

definition: lit. to view the sky from the bottom of a well (idiom); ignorant and narrow-minded
lit. Yelang thinks highly of itself (idiom)/fig. foolish conceit
short-sighted
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
to be shortsighted
arrogant and conceited
to overestimate one's capabilities (idiom)
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
ignorant and inexperienced/ill-informed and narrow-minded
to think of oneself as terrific (idiom); arrogant
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
ignorant/ignorance
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
see 強中自有強中手|强中自有强中手[qiang2 zhong1 zi4 you3 qiang2 zhong1 shou3]
